content: I've gone ahead and setup a project board for tracking issues / RFCs upstream we're supporting https://github.com/rust-lang/project-error-handling/projects/1

It seems the tracking for tasks and progress is spread over these locations:

  • Agenda Action Items.
  • Repo Issues
  • Repo Project Boards. We might end up with more boards in the future.
  • Meeting minutes which are recorded from here.
  • Possibly in Zulip threads.
  • Possibly in Github comments (like discussions within issues)

I can cope with this but I'm wondering if it might cause any confusion in the future, because keeping them in sync might get painful.

Another related issue: It seems we can't pin stuff within Zulip. This might affect on-boarding new members in the future.

I'm guess the repo README would help with on-boarding.
(EDIT: SUMMARY is also an on-boarding document)
Yes, Zulip should rarely be the entrypoint to just about anything.
And don't forget "in :information_desk_person: "
though generally zulip is better entry and then github is synced because it gives a better opportunity for communication
